meanings.definition: Blood cells that play a role in the immune response.
meanings.sent1: The hemocytes in our body fight off germs and keep us healthy.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study hemocytes to understand how our body defends against sickness.
meanings.sent3: The hemocytes had a meeting to discuss how to protect the body from invaders.
meanings.sent4: Like tiny warriors, hemocytes bravely battle against any harmful intruders.
meanings.sent5: The hemocytes act as vigilant guards, always ready to defend the body from harm.

meanings.definition: Cells found in the blood of invertebrates.
meanings.sent1: Invertebrates rely on hemocytes to keep their blood flowing smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the hemocytes under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The hemocytes in the tiny insect's blood were having a dance party.
meanings.sent4: The hemocytes moved like a bustling crowd in the insect's bloodstream.
meanings.sent5: The hemocytes in invertebrates act as tiny messengers, carrying important signals through the body.

meanings.definition: Cells that help to transport oxygen in some animals.
meanings.sent1: Hemocytes in certain animals carry oxygen to all parts of the body.
meanings.sent2: The hemocytes work tirelessly to ensure oxygen reaches every cell.
meanings.sent3: The hemocytes in the fish's body were on a mission to deliver oxygen.
meanings.sent4: Like oxygen couriers, hemocytes swiftly transport the vital gas.
meanings.sent5: The hemocytes act as oxygen taxis, shuttling the life-giving gas throughout the animal's body.
